archetypes.name: Jain-Friendly Vegan Weeknight Basics (No-Heat, Affordable Family)
archetypes.description: Family-friendly vegan dinners built around Indian and South African staples with Jain guardrails (no root vegetables), no-heat seasoning profiles, quick 15–30 minute steps, and an affordable spend for modern SA households.

diet_profile.notes: Jain-friendly: excludes all animal products, root vegetables, and honey; focuses on legumes, grains, and non-root produce for complete proteins.

allergen_flags.cross_contact_notes: Specify vegan and Jain preparation; avoid ghee and shared fryers for dairy/egg contact.

archetypes.rationale: Delivers an ethics-first, kid-safe, affordable weeknight option while expanding coverage for Vegan and Jain-friendly cohorts.

meals.name: Chickpea-Spinach Curry (Jain-Friendly) with Basmati Rice
meals.description: A mild, onion- and garlic-free chickpea and spinach curry finished with coconut milk. Served with fluffy basmati rice for a quick, family-friendly dinner.
prep_steps: Rinse basmati rice under cold water until it runs clear.
Rinse and drain chickpeas if needed.
Measure crushed tomatoes, coconut milk, spices, oil, salt, and water.
cook_steps: Combine basmati rice, 3 cups water, and a pinch of salt in a pot; bring to a boil, then cover and simmer on low until tender, 12–15 minutes. Rest covered 5 minutes, then fluff.
Heat sunflower oil in a pan on medium. Add cumin seeds and toast until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
Stir in crushed tomatoes, turmeric, and salt; simmer 4–5 minutes to reduce slightly.
Add coconut milk and chickpeas; simmer 5–7 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Fold in spinach and cook until wilted and tender, 2–3 minutes.
Stir in garam masala and adjust salt to taste.
Serve curry over basmati rice and top with coriander.
instructions: Rinse basmati rice under cold water until it runs clear.
Rinse spinach and roughly chop.
Rinse and drain chickpeas if needed.
Rinse and chop coriander.

Fold in spinach and cook until wilted and tender, 2–3 minutes.

Serve curry over basmati rice and top with coriander.

meals.name: Tomato-Lentil Cabbage Stew with Soft Pap (Jain-Friendly)
meals.description: A mild, hearty lentil and cabbage tomato stew finished with a cumin tempering, served alongside soft maize meal pap. Vegan, Jain-friendly, and family-focused with no heat.
prep_steps: Rinse lentils under cold water until water runs clear.
Measure maize meal and water for pap.
Measure diced tomatoes, peas, sunflower oil, cumin seeds, turmeric, and salt.
cook_steps: Make pap: Bring 6 cups water and a pinch of salt to a boil in a pot. Whisk in 2 cups maize meal gradually to avoid lumps, reduce heat to low, cover, and cook 15–20 minutes, stirring occasionally until soft.
Cook lentils: In a separate pot, combine lentils, 4 cups water, turmeric, and a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, then simmer 12–15 minutes until just tender.
Add diced tomatoes, cabbage, and peas to the lentils. Simmer 5–8 minutes until cabbage is tender and stew thickens. Adjust salt to taste.
Temper cumin: Heat sunflower oil in a small pan on medium. Add cumin seeds and let them sizzle 30–45 seconds until fragrant. Pour the tempered oil over the stew and stir.
Fluff pap and divide among plates. Ladle the stew alongside and garnish with coriander.
instructions: Rinse lentils under cold water until water runs clear.
Shred cabbage into thin strips.
Roughly chop coriander leaves.
Measure maize meal and water for pap.
Measure diced tomatoes, peas, sunflower oil, cumin seeds, turmeric, and salt.

Make pap: Bring 6 cups water and a pinch of salt to a boil in a pot. Whisk in 2 cups maize meal gradually to avoid lumps, reduce heat to low, cover, and cook 15–20 minutes, stirring occasionally until soft.
Cook lentils: In a separate pot, combine lentils, 4 cups water, turmeric, and a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, then simmer 12–15 minutes until just tender.
Add diced tomatoes, cabbage, and peas to the lentils. Simmer 5–8 minutes until cabbage is tender and stew thickens. Adjust salt to taste.
Temper cumin: Heat sunflower oil in a small pan on medium. Add cumin seeds and let them sizzle 30–45 seconds until fragrant. Pour the tempered oil over the stew and stir.
Fluff pap and divide among plates. Ladle the stew alongside and garnish with coriander.

meals.name: Tofu & Pea Coconut Korma (Jain-Friendly) with Brown Basmati
meals.description: Mild, creamy coconut korma with tofu and peas, served over brown basmati rice. No onion, no garlic, and family-friendly for a quick weeknight dinner.
prep_steps: Rinse brown basmati rice until water runs clear.
Measure cumin seeds, turmeric, garam masala, and salt.
Open coconut milk and diced tomatoes.
cook_steps: Combine brown basmati rice with water in a pot, bring to a boil, then cover and simmer until tender; keep warm.
Heat sunflower oil in a wide pan on medium; add cumin seeds and toast until fragrant.
Stir in turmeric, then add diced tomatoes; simmer 3–4 minutes to reduce slightly.
Pour in coconut milk and add salt; stir to combine.
Add tofu and peas; simmer gently 8–10 minutes until peas are tender and sauce thickens.
Stir in garam masala and adjust salt to taste; rest 2 minutes off heat.
Fluff rice and plate; spoon korma over rice and finish with coriander.

archetypes.name: Solo Quick Bites Flex
archetypes.description: Fast, one-pan or air-fryer friendly meals for solo diners who eat mostly plant-forward with occasional animal protein; mild spice, familiar SA/Modern American flavors, Under-15-minute prep, Simple complexity, and ValueStaples budget for tight weeknights.

allergen_flags.cross_contact_notes: Use separate utensils/boards if adding animal proteins; choose certified nut-free pantry staples to maintain nut avoidance.

archetypes.rationale: Delivers mainstream, budget-friendly solo meals with mild heat and Under-15-minute prep without overlapping prior family weeknight archetypes.

meals.name: One-Pan BBQ Chickpea Spinach Melt on Toast
meals.description: A quick, mild, plant-forward toast melt with BBQ chickpeas, spinach, and cheddar, all done in one pan. Fast and satisfying for solo weeknights.
prep_steps: Preheat a nonstick pan on medium heat.
cook_steps: Add olive oil to the pan; cook red onion 1–2 minutes until softened.
Add chickpeas and BBQ sauce; mash lightly with a spatula and heat 2–3 minutes until warmed through. Season with salt and pepper. Push mixture to one side of the pan.
Place both bread slices in the empty side of the pan; toast 1–2 minutes per side until lightly golden.
Top one slice with the warm BBQ chickpeas, then add spinach and cheddar cheese.
Cover the pan and lower heat; cook 2–3 minutes until the cheese melts.
Place the second toast slice on top, press gently, then remove and serve.

meals.name: One-Pan Tomato Spinach Eggs on Toast
meals.description: Quick stovetop eggs nestled in a mild tomato-spinach sauté, served over toasted bread with a sprinkle of feta. Simple, comforting, and ready fast for one.
prep_steps: 6. Set out bread slices and a lidded skillet.
cook_steps: 1. Heat olive oil in a small skillet over medium heat.
2. Add red onion and sauté 1 minute until starting to soften; add garlic and cook 20–30 seconds until fragrant.
3. Stir in tomato, a pinch of salt and pepper; cook 2–3 minutes until juicy.
4. Add spinach and toss until just wilted, 30–60 seconds; level the mixture.
5. Make two small wells and crack in eggs; season tops with a pinch of salt and pepper.
6. Cover and cook 3–5 minutes until whites are set and yolks to your liking (lower heat if bubbling hard).
7. While eggs cook, toast bread.
8. Slide the tomato-spinach eggs over toast and sprinkle with feta. Serve immediately.
instructions: 1. Finely chop red onion (about 2 tbsp).
2. Mince garlic clove.
3. Dice tomato.
4. Rinse and drain spinach.
5. Crumble feta (if using).
6. Set out bread slices and a lidded skillet.

In the same pan, add 1 tablespoon olive oil; sauté onion and bell peppers with a pinch of salt for 4–5 minutes until softened.
Stir in garlic for 30 seconds, then add chickpeas and spinach; cook 2–3 minutes until spinach wilts. Squeeze in 1 tablespoon lemon juice; adjust salt and pepper to taste.
Place couscous in a heatproof bowl with a pinch of salt and 1 teaspoon olive oil; pour over 2.5 cups boiling water, cover, and steam for 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork.
Slice the rested chicken.
Assemble bowls: couscous base, top with the chickpea-veg mix and sliced chicken. Spoon over lemon yoghurt and scatter parsley. Finish with extra lemon zest if desired.

meals.name: Lemon-Oregano Chicken Orzo with Peppadew & Feta
meals.description: Bright lemon and oregano chicken served over orzo with sweet peppadew peppers, cherry tomatoes, and a light feta crumble. A mild Mediterranean bowl with a South African twist, ready in about 25 minutes.
prep_steps: 1. Bring a large saucepan of water to a boil for the orzo.
6. Cut the chicken breast into bite-size strips.

cook_steps: 1. Salt the boiling water, add orzo, and cook until just tender; reserve 1/2 cup cooking water, then drain.
2. Heat 2 tbsp olive oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat.
3. Add chicken and cook, stirring, until lightly browned and cooked through, 5–7 minutes; transfer to a plate.
4. In the same pan over medium heat, add garlic and cherry tomatoes; cook until tomatoes soften, 2–3 minutes.
5. Return chicken to the pan, add peppadew peppers, remaining lemon zest, and lemon juice; toss for 1 minute.
6. Add drained orzo to the pan with a splash of reserved cooking water to loosen; season with salt and pepper to taste.
7. Remove from heat and scatter feta over the top; toss gently and serve.
